11.content:
A male character, huh?
Okay, how about one of these guys?

1 - Aaron Grath
Aaron is a college student, with medium length blonde hair and blue eyes. He plays for his college's rugby team, which had lead to him developing a good amount of muscle.

After a hard day of practice, Aaron finds himself alone in the changing rooms. As he is packing up, he discovers a mysterious book filled with pictures...

2 - Damien Johnson
Damien is the older brother of Lilith. He is 17 years old, with short brown hair and green eyes. He is a diligent student, and likes to help his sister study in the library.

One day after school, Damien and Lilith find themselves studying together in the library. Damien decides to take a break and browse the shelves. He finds herself in the Children's section, where he stumbles upon a rather interesting picture book...

3 - Lind Frazier
Lind Frazier is your typical know-it-all. He has short-clipped brown hair with matching brown eyes. Despite his impressive knowledge, Lind tends to slack off in class and perv on girls.

However, when a new girl called Rose joins his class, Lind tries his best to win her over. In a ploy to get him away from the rest of the girls, Rose gives him a book filled with various pictures...

4 - Jason Luster
Jason is your typical business man. He is in his late fourties with greying hair and stern green eyes. Jason tends to think more of the money than the people, leading to him having a lot of enemies.

After obtaining permission to demolish a row of houses, an irate mother sends him a 'gift'. When he opens this gift, he is so confused to find a small picture book...

111.content:
Aaron smashed into the ground. Hard.
He was fully aware of the situation unfolding around him. The ball was ripped from his grasp by one of his team mates, who gave it a good hard boot up the pitch. A second later, the rest of his team tore past him, everybody ignoring him except for one.

"Come on, Aaron!"
A rough hand reached down to him, which he quickly grasped.
"We haven't lost yet!"
His best friend, Nick, flashed him a grin before following the rest of the team. Aaron wasted no time in following, ignoring the pain in his right side.

A couple of minutes later, the match was over. Aaron's team narrowly won the match by a single try touched down in the last minute. His team all congratulated Nick, the one who did it, leaving Aaron sulking in the corner. If he hadn't been tackled, then he would've been the one to touch down at the end of the pitch.

"Don't be so hard on yourself, mate," Nick said, collapsing onto the bench next to Aaron. "You got it up the pitch for me. Without you..."
"Yeah, yeah, I know," Aaron said, waving the words away. "That's me. The supporting role of the whole team".
Nick shook his head.
"And you don't think that that's important? You may not score much, but you enable us to score, you know?"

Aaron was silent for a moment before letting out a reluctant sigh.
"Yeah, I suppose you're right..." He admitted before grinning at Nick. "Now get going. You know Kennedy will want to congratulate you".
Nick rolled his eyes.
"Don't remind me..." He said before marching off. "I'll catch you later!"

Aaron watched the rest of his team slowly file out before deciding to move. Grabbing his school shirt, he pulled his blue rugby jersey over his head and threw it into his bag. He wiped mud from his muscular chest before pulling his shirt on.
"Might not score much..." He muttered as he buttoned his top. "If the rest of the team supported me, then maybe I could..."

After pulling his trousers and shoes on, Aaron chucked his gear into his bag. As he scanned the changing rooms for anything left behind by him or his team, he spotted a small book with a grey cover.
"What is this?" He wondered, grabbing the book. "Better question, who owns it?"

Flipping open the front cover, he found no name, which was odd. School rules dictated that all books must have the owners name scrawled somewhere within its pages. And yet, there was nothing in it.

Turning to the next page, Aaron was surprised to find pictures of...

113.content:
"Alright, class, listen in!"
Mrs Steels's commanding voice echoed around the classroom, silencing all conversations in progress. Slowly, all eyes turned to face her, all except...
"Mr Frazier!" She barked, focusing in on one student with short brown hair.
"How many times do I have to tell you, stop staring at other students!"

Lind, who had been staring at Sarah, a pretty girl with long black hair pulled into a ponytail, looked to the front with a smirk on his face.
"Sorry, Mrs. But Sarah's hair looks especially luscious today".
At the mention of her name, Sarah shrunk back into her chair while the other girls sat around her snickered.

"Alright, settle down!"
The girls all feel silent.
"Last warning, Lind," Mrs Steele warmed, staring directly at Lind. "No more of this... behaviour".
Lind shrugged, to which Mrs Steele narrowed her eyes dangerously.

After a few seconds, the tension seemed to dissipate as Mrs Steele got back in track.
"We have a new student joining us today. Rose is an exceptionally gifted student, perhaps the equivalent of our own Lind".
Lind leaned back in his chair at the praise. Despite his constant slacking off and... inspection... of his classmates, he was probably the smartest in the entire class.

Having somebody that could keep up with him could be interesting, but Lind was more interested in how she looked. If she looked like a cow's ass, then whatever. But if she didn't, then class might become a lot more fun. For him, anyway.
"Rose?"
The door swung open. Lind's eyes lit up.

Lind had been expecting some mediocre girl that would blend in with the rest of his class, with the exception of maybe one or two girls.
What he didn't expect was a Goddess in mortal form. Perfect blue eyes, long and silky-looking black hair with purple highlights, a soft face...
He grinned. He had found her at last...

Rose scanned the room. Her eyes fell upon the smiling Lind. She frowned as though his presence annoyed her.
"There's an empty desk next to Lind," Mrs Steele said. "And feel free to ignore Lind".

Taking her seat next to Lind, Rose refused to look anywhere near him. Lind was prepared to introduce himself, maybe try a few of his patented pick-up lines, but Mrs Steele took that moment to start class. Reluctantly, he decided to wait until after class had ended to talk with Rose.

As soon as the bell had rung, Lind pushed his plan into action.
"Hey, I'm Lind," he said, leaning over. "Might I say-"
"No, you won't".
Rose turned to face him, an icy stare on her face.
"I've heard all about you, Lind Frazier. Nothing you try on me will work. Rather, it's what I try on you!"

She rummaged through her bag, pulling out a grey book which she handed to Lind. Without a word, she poured her belongings into her bag and marched out, leaving Lind alone.
"Playing hard to get, huh? And what would this be?" Lind wondered.
"Perhaps a picture book of you?"

Flipping open to a random page, Lind found himself staring at pictures of...

121.content:
"HAPPY BIRTHDAY TO YOU!"
Claps and cheers filled the small kitchen, along with a single whistle. Jess looked around at the people gathered in the kitchen. Her smiling father with his greying beard, her mother with her kind eyes and kinder smile, her best friend, Megan, and her boyfriend, Kevin.

Jess opened her mouth to speak, yet no words came out. She had had parties in the past, but they had been huge parties in massive clubs with about a hundred people. This small gathering of her family and her closest friends... She didn't know why, but it rendered her speechless.

Thankfully, Kevin stepped in.
"Happy birthday, Jess!" he said with a huge smile. He pulled her into a hug, which incited a snicker from Megan and a disapproving look from her father.
"Thanks, everybody..." Jess managed to get out, still overwhelmed by the whole ordeal.

After Jess had calmed down and everybody had had a bit of cake, the party moved into the slightly larger living room. A small pile of presents sat in front of the fire place. Sitting next to them, Jess wasted no time in ripping through them.

From her parents, she received a new phone, something she had desperately needed for a number of months.
Megan had got her a selection of clothes, ranging from a couple of new tops to a rather fashionable jacket.

When she lifted the final present, labelled with a scrawled 'Kevin'...
"Let's not open that here, shall we?" Kevin laughed nervously, eyeing her father, who shot an angry look back. "It's, uh... unsuitable for present company".
Jess gave him a knowing smile before moving into the final present.

Unlike the others, which had been wrapped in bright paper, this one was covered in a layer of musty brown paper and sellotape. After a small battle involving a pair of scissors, Megan's sharp nails and a knife, Jess managed to get through the paper.

"A... Picture book?"
Jess eyed the book with disdain. She wasn't the biggest reader in the world, preferring the company of people to that of books. Whoever had bought her this clearly didn't know her that well.

The rest of the room, however, paid no mind to it. In fact, it was almost as though the book didn't exist. Kevin shot her a wink, while her mother moved on with the camera, ushering the entire room together in front of the fire place for the customary birthday photograph.

After the party had winded down, and Kevin and Megan had headed home, Jess found herself sitting alone in her room, a bottle of beer clutched in her hand.
"Another year gone..." She murmered, taking a large swig from her bottle. "I really need to figure something out with my life..."

As Jess took another swig, the picture book caught her eye. She had no idea who had got her it, not did she particularly care, but something about the book was drawing her in, inviting her to read it, to gaze upon its contents...

Reaching over, Jess grabbed the book. It was similar in size to a children's book. Its cover was pure grey with nothing on it.
"Sounds intriguing..." Jess yawned. "Hopefully whatever is inside it is better..."

Flipping open to a random page, Jess found herself gazing at pictures of...

122.content:
Letting out a sigh, Lily slowly flipped the page of the book she was meant to be studying.
"Something wrong, sis?" Her brother inquired, looking up from his own book. "You seem really down!"
Lily shook her head.
"No, it's fine..." She replied half-heartedly.

Of course, it wasn't fine. Yet another of her class mates now used a training bra, meaning she was the only girl in her class who didn't wear one. And as much as she tried to ignore this, Penny didn't let her.

Lily snorted.
Perfect Penny, with her great marks in tests and exams. Teachers adored her, the other girls in her class wanted to be her and the guys in her class wanted to be with her. And who could blame any of them? Penny had started going through puberty years ago, and was still subject to the occasional growth spurt.

As a result of this, she had a huge chest. Forget training bra, Penny used an adult bra! Her chest was like the size of her own mothers! And the rest of her body... Long black hair that was silky smooth, a beautiful face, nice wide hips and a full backside...

Lily hated her, and Penny knew it. Everyday, it was constant teasing over her boyish body. The only remotely female part of her was her long red hair, which Lily had insisted be left alone. It hung down past her backside, almost touching her knees now.

"Sis?"
Her brother's calm voice made her snap. She knew he was only trying to help, as she appreciated it, but at that moment in time, she didn't want it. She just wanted to be alone with her thoughts.

Without a word, Lily stood up and stormed off. She heard her brother let out a sigh, having realised that things were not okay with her. But by the time he had decided to follow her, it was probably too late. The library was a huge place, and to search it all for one person would take hours.

Lily had no idea where she was until she stopped in front of a familiar looking set of bookcases. Compared to the ceiling high shelves that were the norm in the rest of the library, the children's section had tiny shelves with barely any books on them. And the books that were there, the majority were copies of one another.

And yet, she didn't care. The children's section was a place of happy memories for her. She remembered coming here with Damien almost every day to read or study. She would always walk out with a handful of books cradled in her arms, and by the next visit, she had finished them all.

Without really thinking, she grabbed a book off of one of the small shelves. Flipping open to a random page, Lily saw pictures of...

"W-What the hell?!" Penny stuttered, looking between her hand and Lily's chest. "How did you... It's impossible!"

Penny, however, eyed her hand with suspicion.
"Why should I?" She demanded, her voice wavering. "For all I know, you'll-"
"Make all your dreams come true?" Lily cut in. "Or I could bring your worst nightmares to life. The choice is all yours".

At the mention of her worst nightmares coming to life, Penny gave in.
"Alright, fine!" She conceded. "But I want somebody to come with me!"
Lily shook her head, her red hair swaying back and forth in a mesmerising manner.

Penny grumbled unhappily before letting out a long sigh, her warm breath washing over Lily's face.
"Whatever... But I'm warming you now, Johnson. Any weird moves, and everybody will hear about it. Got me?"

"Follow me..." Lily whispered, finally pulling away from her and leading her out of the classroom.

Despite the bell having rung, Lily continued to lead Penny down various corridors until she reached a small, forgotten room.
"This is where you wanted to lead me?" Penny asked, making a face at the small door. "Where even is this?!"
Lily remained silent, pushing the door open and ushering Penny in.

Inside was a small room. Lily had used it in the past to escape Penny and her cronies, and had quickly adopted it as her own personal hideout. She had 'acquired' a couple of chairs, bought a couple of cushions and taken an old box from the trash to act as a table. She pushed Penny towards one of the seat before sitting on her own.

"So, what's this secret?"
Lily smirked back, placing a small book on the table in response.
"A book?" Penny eyed the book with obvious suspicion. "A book made your chest swell into melons?"

"Open it to a random page," Lily ordered her. "And tell me what you see".
Penny sighed as she flipped the book open. Her eyes scanned down the page, her brow slowly furrowing in confusion.
"Well?" Lily inquired. "What is it?"

Penny looked up with confusion before answering...

123.content:
"Messy kids..."
Eleanor let out a sigh as she surveyed the mess before her. The room looked as though a hurricane had run through it at some point. Toys were strewn across the floor, dolls lay abandoned on beds, pillows sat on the floor...

Of course, she had expected this. Her twin daughters, Elizabeth and Serana, were the two messiest children Eleanor had even seen. They managed to spill food down themselves at every meal, they managed to get water on the floor during bath time and their room... Well, what she was looking at was mild. Everything after the paint incident was mild.

Grabbing a basket, Eleanor marched around the room, chucking dirty clothes into it. After the clothes, she moved onto the toys. The pair didn't like to share, meaning Eleanor had to fork out the money for two of the same toy. They were swiftly returned to their corresponding toy box.

Then came the dolls. Thankfully, Elizabeth's dolls all had the colour red on them somewhere, while Serena insisted on having pink on her. It was one of the few ways to tell the pair apart, another being the slight differences in their favourite hair styles.

After the dolls had been returned to their resting places in the shelves above the two beds, Eleanor stopped for a rest. She looked around at the much cleaner room, thinking about how it would look in a couple of hours after the twins returned home from school.

As she ran her eye over the room, she spotted something that she had never seen before. A small picture book with a grey cover...
"I don't remember buying them this..." Eleanor mused as she picked it up. She knew every toy that she had bought, and the book didn't have a pair, meaning it didn't belong in that room.

"I suppose I should take a look. Perhaps it belongs to a friend of theirs?"
Flipping the book open, Eleanor found herself looking at...

1231.content:
At various pictures of women…?

“What on earth…?” Eleanor mumbled in confusion, questioning how such a book ended up in her daughters’ room.

The worried mother continued studying the page she opened and was surprised at the different types of women she saw.

There was a heavily obese woman, in some completely stained outfit and small ill-fitting clothes, sporting an enormous hanging gut that reached her knees, thick beefy arms and chunky thighs that were connected to a fat ass and a set of huge swollen breasts; who looked like Trailer Trash.

Another obese looking woman, similar to the previous picture, but this one looked more elegant and was wearing a stunning red dress that was deliberately showing off her curves. A lustful pleasure-seeker of sorts…

Quickly looking away from those two, Eleanor curiously flipped the page, to further check the book and found even more pictures. She saw a woman completely stacked with muscle, a woman gently and lovingly stroking her swollen belly, but then she found some… weirder ones.

A woman covered in white fur with large breasts and a heavy udder dangling between her legs. A woman with a strange bulge in her trousers and lastly a woman covered in scales, sharp claws and oddly looking thick hind legs.

Eventually, Eleanor looked away from the book, her face completely puzzled at what she saw and muttered to herself, “Why would Elizabeth and Serena have a book like this…?”

As after all a single mom, her husband passed away some time ago, leaving her alone to look after her mischievous angels, but never had she come across something this strange. She flipped back to the page with the fat women. "Wherever this book came from, it doesn’t belong here with the kids."

Eleanor was getting ready to close the book and throw it away in the rubbish outside, so; she could pay no further attention towards it.

However, she oddly… couldn’t. She found her eyes slowly focusing on one of the pictures, as if it was calling out towards her, seeking for her attention and approval...

124.content:
"Samantha!"
Samantha let out a sigh as she heard her mother's voice reach her from downstairs. She had been enjoying this new book, and right before the cool action part, her mother had decided to interrupt.
"Yes, mummy?" She called back.

Her mother didn't respond, causing Sam to let out an irritated growl. Her mother would call her name and when Samantha responded, she had walked off. Sure, she knew to go downstairs, but she hated how she did it. Why not just come upstairs? Was it so important that she had to move away from her comfortable bed?

Pouting, Samantha rolled off her bed and into her feet. She headed downstairs, where she found her mother standing with a large parcel.
"Peter sent you something, dear," she explained, jiggling the package.
Sam let out a joyful squeal, snatching the package from her mother and racing back upstairs.

In her room, Sam dropped the package into the floor and sat cross-legged next to it. She loved when her brother sent packages! They were always full of nice things, like pretty clothes and tasty sweets! Once, he had even sent her this cool piggy bank in the shape of a camel!

Ripping the box open, Sam let out a squeal of delight. The first thing she saw was loads of sweets.
"There's like ten bags!" She realised, counting them out. "And they're all fizzy!"
Despite constant warnings from their mother, Peter still insisted on sending fizzy sweets to Sam. They made her so hyper, and she loved them.

After pulling all the sweets out, Sam reached back into the box. She pulled out a blue t-shirt with a happy penguin on it. She smiled at the penguin, which just happened to be her favourite animal. They were so cute and cuddly...

Putting the t-shirt to the side, Sam reached back into the box. Her hand closed around a small item, which turned out to be a rather bland book. It had no blurb and both covers were completely grey.
"It looks boring..." She complained. "Wonder if the story is any good?"

Flipping to a random page, Sam found herself staring at pictures of...

1241.content:
Sam may have loved the gifts Peter brought for her, but the one thing she was puzzled with is the bland book she’s holding. She may have number of questions as to why Peter wanted to give this to her. But regardless, Sam shrugged and gives this book a shot and see what’s in them.

What happens next is quite a surprise, but also come with shock at the same time. Sam has gotten to the first couple of pages, seeing pictures of the girls in different shapes and forms. But what’s even shocking to her is that every page the picture it has here, seemed to have some kind of a same girl each and every one. She was left confused at first, before realised by the look on the face, which she begin to realised who this girl was?

“Wait a minute! Is that.... me in every single page?” Sam looked surprise and realised it is her, but every page seem to look much different as far as looks and shapes in concerned.

For example, the first page contains her looking a lot obese for an eight year old. The picture shows her in bottom heavy shaped, making the girl’s butt and thighs larger and wider, as well as the belly that’s look a lot fatter too! The arms are looking thick, and her face is the same too, but still had that cute look, which made Sam blushed heavily in nerves.

Then on the next page, Sam comes across herself looking much older than her actual age in reality. It looked like she’s grown up ten years later, looking eighteen years of age, matured and even good looking, much to the girl’s real life confusing about Peter’s somewhat bizarre reason behind this one.

“I can’t believe my brother gave me this book, so he let me show what I really look like. But why would he do such a thing?” Sam says rather concerned by any means.

But something goes through her mind, as each time she see’s the picture of it, it made her feel more curious the more she stares at it more. So much so, that an eight year old girl is starting to invest this book all the sudden and decides to what?

12411.content:
Flicking quickly through the book, Samantha kept returning to one particular picture.

"She's so fat!" Sam exclaimed upon her fifth return to the picture of her obese self. "How'd she get that big?!"

The picture didn't answer, leading to Samantha staring at it in thought. She tapped the floor next to her as she continuously inspected every aspect of the picture.

info.brief_description: Somebody finds an odd book with the power to change the longer they read...
info.description:
Yet another simple story, featuring all new characters!

A character of your choosing stumbles upon a picturebook. This book contains an infinite number of pages with an infinite number of different categories.
Depending on the page the chosen character reads, they will then undergo a gradual transformation pertaining to the category they are reading while they are reading it.

Let's have an example, shall we?

A girl reads a section of the book referencing weight gain in today's society. While she reads, both her mind and body are altered by the book, making her fatter and lazier. This will continue for as long as she reads.

And to make matters worse for the reader, the book has a mild addiction quality, making it harder and harder to put down the longer the reader reads it.

Like I said, a simple enough story. And like almost every story on this website, there are some rules to prevent the story from falling into complete and utter chaos:

1 - Unlike my other story, you can use any gender, any age. An elderly man in his eighties? Go ahead! A female toddler? Why not!

2 - Any transformation goes. Give a girl a dick and a guy a pussy? Go for it! Turn a guy into a immobile slug-girl that is also a pregnant bimbo? I don't see why not!

3 - Make sure you write a half decent entry. That means good grammar, at least a paragraph in length, unless it's an option chapter, and don't deviate from the previous chapter. If the option selected is 'Weight Gain', then write something about weight gain. Nothing about inflation or something irrelevant.

4 - Transformations are to be gradual. No instant gaining of a million pounds, or 'He read one word and suddenly he was a cowgirl'.

5 - No excessive option chapters. One or two is fine, but if I see whole strings of 'Something else', then I'm busting out my deletion authority. It's fair game at the start until you find your chosen transformation, however.

6 - Did I mention any transformation works? Like, literally anything you can think of.

And with that, I think that's everything. Rules will be updated, because I know I've forgotten stuff.

Enjoy the story!
